title: 行政長官辦公室: 克魯茲發表言論前應思考

replies.msg:
行政長官辦公室回應傳媒查詢
＊＊＊＊＊＊＊＊＊＊＊＊＊
就今日（十月十三日）傳媒對美國國會參議員克魯茲有關香港言論的查詢，行政長官辦公室發言人作以下回應：

我們尊重外國政客發表言論的自由，但言論應以事實為基礎。事實上，所有人都可以從傳媒報道中看到，近月香港多次出現暴力示威者作出暴力及破壞行為，更有蒙面暴徒在不同地區破壞公共設施和商鋪、縱火和投擲汽油彈，並肆意襲擊警務人員和持不同意見的市民，嚴重破壞社會秩序。對克魯茲表示未有見到示威者的暴力行為，實在匪夷所思。

面對持續升級的暴力行為，特區政府及警方有必要依法採取果斷措施應對。外國政客發表言論前應思考，若同樣情況出現在他們自己國家，他們會如何處理；而不應不負責任地肆意批評香港，甚至以不同方式表達對暴力行為的支持或認同。

行政長官原計劃於昨日應對方要求與克魯茲會面，後因行政長官另有公務而取消。一如行政長官過去與眾多外賓會面，會面原定以閉門形式進行，雙方均不會公開引述會面內容，克魯茲之前對此安排不持異議。

完
2019年10月13日（星期日）
香港時間18時35分

https://www.info.gov.hk/gia/general/201910/13/P2019101300609.htm
完
繼續口交
Noted.

quote.msg:
行政長官辦公室回應傳媒查詢
＊＊＊＊＊＊＊＊＊＊＊＊＊
就今日（十月十三日）傳媒對美國國會參議員克魯茲有關香港言論的查詢，行政長官辦公室發言人作以下回應：

我們尊重外國政客發表言論的自由，但言論應以事實為基礎。事實上，所有人都可以從傳媒報道中看到，近月香港多次出現暴力示威者作出暴力及破壞行為，更有蒙面暴徒在不同地區破壞公共設施和商鋪、縱火和投擲汽油彈，並肆意襲擊警務人員和持不同意見的市民，嚴重破壞社會秩序。對克魯茲表示未有見到示威者的暴力行為，實在匪夷所思。

面對持續升級的暴力行為，特區政府及警方有必要依法採取果斷措施應對。外國政客發表言論前應思考，若同樣情況出現在他們自己國家，他們會如何處理；而不應不負責任地肆意批評香港，甚至以不同方式表達對暴力行為的支持或認同。

行政長官原計劃於昨日應對方要求與克魯茲會面，後因行政長官另有公務而取消。一如行政長官過去與眾多外賓會面，會面原定以閉門形式進行，雙方均不會公開引述會面內容，克魯茲之前對此安排不持異議。

完
2019年10月13日（星期日）
香港時間18時35分

https://www.info.gov.hk/gia/general/201910/13/P2019101300609.htm

__________________________
Chief Executive Office: Ted Cruz should think twice before speech
According to the media's inquiry about American senator Ted Cruz today (13 October), Chief Executive would like to respond as follows:-

We respect freedom of speech of foreign politician, but the speech should be based on fact. In fact, everyone can watch from media that Hong Kong violent protester did violent and damaging behaviors, and some of the of masked rioters destroyed public facilities and shops, commit arson and throwing petrol bomb and attack police officer and people holding different views, which significantly destroy society. Regarding Ted Cruz saying that he cannot observe the violent behaviors to protesters, we feel ridiculous.

Facing the escalating violent behaviors, special administrative region and police have to pick up decisive policy. Foreign politician should think twice before any speech, especially how to deal with the incidents when occur in their country; they should not irresponsibly criticize and encourage or agree the violent behaviors.

Chief executive planned to meet Ted Cruz as per his request, but chief executive cancel the meeting due to other affair. Same with the previous meeting, this meeting was designated to be a closed meeting, both sides should not quote the content of this meeting, and Ted Cruz had no objection to this arrangement.

End
13th October 2019 (Sunday)
Hong Kong Time 18:35

Chief Executive Office: Ted Cruz should think twice before speech
According to the media's inquiry about American senator Ted Cruz today (13 October), Chief Executive would like to respond as follows:-

We respect freedom of speech of foreign politician, but the speech should be based on fact. In fact, everyone can watch from media that Hong Kong violent protester did violent and damaging behaviors, and some of the of masked rioters destroyed public facilities and shops, commit arson and throwing petrol bomb and attack police officer and people holding different views, which significantly destroy society. Regarding Ted Cruz saying that he cannot observe the violent behaviors to protesters, we feel ridiculous.

Facing the escalating violent behaviors, special administrative region and police have to pick up decisive policy. Foreign politician should think twice before any speech, especially how to deal with the incidents when occur in their country; they should not irresponsibly criticize and encourage or agree the violent behaviors.

Chief executive planned to meet Ted Cruz as per his request, but chief executive cancel the meeting due to other affair. Same with the previous meeting, this meeting was designated to be a closed meeting, both sides should not quote the content of this meeting, and Ted Cruz had no objection to this arrangement.

End
13th October 2019 (Sunday)
Hong Kong Time 18:35

Response by CE's Office to media enquiries
***********************************
In response to media enquiries today (October 13) on comments on Hong Kong by US Senator Ted Cruz, a spokesman for the Chief Executive's Office said the following:

While we respect the freedom of speech of foreign politicians, we consider that comments should be based on facts. Everyone can see from media reports that violent protesters conducted violent and vandalistic acts on many occasions in Hong Kong in recent months. Masked rioters vandalised public facilities and shops, committed arson, hurled petrol bombs as well as wantonly attacked police and people with different views in various districts, seriously undermining public order. It is indeed baffling for Mr Cruz to say that he had not seen protesters' violent acts.

In the face of continuous escalation of violence, it is necessary for the Hong Kong Special Administrative Region Government and Police to tackle the situation resolutely in accordance with the law. Before expressing their views, foreign politicians should put thought into the actions they would have taken if the same situation happened in their own country, instead of criticising Hong Kong irresponsibly or even expressing support or endorsement in any form for violent acts.

The Chief Executive originally planned to meet Mr Cruz yesterday at his request but the meeting was cancelled due to the Chief Executive's other duty commitment. The meeting, as with the Chief Executive's previous meetings with various foreign guests, was planned to be closed door whereby both sides would not openly disclose the content of the meeting. Mr Cruz did not raise any objection to the arrangement.

Ends/Sunday, October 13, 2019
Issued at HKT 19:58
NNNN

劣譯英文版，已經post咗去巴打twitter, 麻煩幫手retweet 同埋睇吓有無嘢要edit:

行政長官辦公室回應傳媒查詢
＊＊＊＊＊＊＊＊＊＊＊＊＊
就今日（十月十三日）傳媒對美國國會參議員克魯茲有關香港言論的查詢，行政長官辦公室發言人作以下回應：

Regarding media enquiry on US Senator Ted Cruz about his comment on Hong Kong, the Chief Executive's Office has the below response:

我們尊重外國政客發表言論的自由，但言論應以事實為基礎。事實上，所有人都可以從傳媒報道中看到，近月香港多次出現暴力示威者作出暴力及破壞行為，更有蒙面暴徒在不同地區破壞公共設施和商鋪、縱火和投擲汽油彈，並肆意襲擊警務人員和持不同意見的市民，嚴重破壞社會秩序。對克魯茲表示未有見到示威者的暴力行為，實在匪夷所思。

We respect foreign politician's right to express themselves, but their speech should be made based on facts. And in fact, all people can see from media reports that there are violent protesters acting violently; there are also masked rioters vandalizes public facilities, arsoning with petrol bombs, and attacking police as well as citizens with opposite opinions, posting harmful threats to social order. We feel ridiculous that Senator Cruz overlooks the violent acts performed by protestors.

面對持續升級的暴力行為，特區政府及警方有必要依法採取果斷措施應對。外國政客發表言論前應思考，若同樣情況出現在他們自己國家，他們會如何處理；而不應不負責任地肆意批評香港，甚至以不同方式表達對暴力行為的支持或認同。

With the escalating situation, the HKSAR government and Hong Kong police force must firmly exercise the law. Rather than critizing Hong Kong irresponsibly or even agreeing with the violent acts in different ways, foreign politicians should think before they comment: If the same happens in your country, how would you handle it.

行政長官原計劃於昨日應對方要求與克魯茲會面，後因行政長官另有公務而取消。一如行政長官過去與眾多外賓會面，會面原定以閉門形式進行，雙方均不會公開引述會面內容，克魯茲之前對此安排不持異議

The HKCE Carrie Lam agreed to meet Senator Cruz but was cancelled because of the clash in schedule with other duties. Same as other meetings of the CE with foreign guests, the meeting should be a closed-door one and both meeting parties shall not quote the meeting contents. Senator Cruz does not have objection to the above arrangements.

The End
13 October 2019 (Sunday)
18:35 Hong Kong Time

完
2019年10月13日（星期日）
香港時間18時35分
